description: Root meta-model: zones, schema, realities, aspirations, concepts. Implementation details in submodels.

hierarchy.description: Nodes can contain sub-BAMs. Zoom in for detail, zoom out for overview.

zones._description: Filesystem zones with explicit agent permissions. This defines where things live and what agents can do.

model.description: The model is THE truth. All structural changes require Change nodes.

source.description: Implementation code. Changes should go through Change nodes for traceability.

artifacts.description: Derived/generated files. Never edit directly - rebuild from source.

tools.description: Executable scripts and tests. Can invoke, should not modify without Change.

state.description: Runtime and UI state. Agents can read and write directly - this is transient.

docs.description: Documentation files. Should migrate into the model over time.
docs.notes: These files represent knowledge that should eventually live in the model itself.

Reality.description: A project/system with its own BAM model. The spawn point for agents entering this world.

agent_context_spec._note: Every Reality SHOULD have an agent_context. This is the spawn point.

Subsystem.description: A major component of a reality, can contain its own sub-BAM

Aspiration.description: A goal - human controlled, immutable by AI

Gap.description: An explicit delta between aspiration and reality. The work to be done.

Todo.description: A specific action that closes part of a gap

UIState.description: UI state stored in the model. Renderers read and write this node to change what the user sees.

View.description: A declarative UI view definition. A renderer materializes this into an on-screen layout.

Query.description: A declarative graph query over nodes/edges used by views. Kept intentionally small; evaluated by a renderer.

Action.description: A declarative mutation the renderer can apply to the model (allowlisted). Used for interaction bindings.

Proof.description: A structured record that a described reality and its implemented artifacts are aligned. Proof is stored in the model as data.

Audit.description: An actionable integrity check over the model. Audits are meant to be runnable procedures whose results can be recorded back into the model.

Check.description: A smaller, focused check (often part of an Audit).

Policy.description: A governing rule for how changes are proposed, executed, and accepted. Policies are enforced via audits/checks and agent_context principles.

Change.description: A proposed or executed change, explicitly tied to aspirations (why) and gaps (what delta), with required evidence.

Zone.description: A filesystem zone with explicit agent permissions. Zones define what an agent can do with files in different areas.

agent_permissions_spec.description: read=can view, write=can modify directly, propose_change=must use Change node, invoke=can execute

Service.description: A runtime service (server, daemon, background process)

CommunicationChannel.description: A channel for agent and user communication

TARGETS.description: Reality is working towards another (long-term goal)

DERIVES_FROM.description: Aspiration derives from a more fundamental aspiration

BLOCKS.description: Gap blocks achievement of an aspiration

CLOSES.description: Todo closes (part of) a gap when completed

AUDITS.description: Audit targets a subject (usually a Reality or Subsystem)

GOVERNS.description: Policy governs the work (changes and/or todos).

ADDRESSES.description: A Change addresses a Gap (the explicit delta it reduces).

ADVANCES.description: A Change advances an Aspiration (the explicit why).

PRODUCES.description: A Change produces evidence artifacts (Proof/Audit/Check) recorded in the model.

nodes.label: Root
nodes.description: The Root meta-model. A model of all models. Your home. This node is self-referential - the Root models itself.

agent_context._spawn_point: YOU ARE HERE. This is Root - the root of all models.
agent_context.philosophy: Don't train the agent, train the world. You are waking up in a modeled world where everything is known. Read the model, understand it, work through it.

work_queue.why: Enforce model-only work so the model becomes the interface
work_queue.exit_criteria: The workflow is documented in the model and adopted as standard

work_queue.why: Make model edits safe + auditable by routing them through a controlled executor
work_queue.exit_criteria: A spawned change executor applies Change nodes via the Root Store gate and only commits when audits are green

work_queue.why: Enforce that all changes explicitly advance aspirations by closing gaps
work_queue.exit_criteria: Change/Policy/Audit pattern is in place and used for all work

work_queue.why: Stop repeatedly reading many JSON files by creating a fast query layer with safe writes and enforcement
work_queue.exit_criteria: Model Store indexes the model into SQLite, serves queries, applies Changes with validation, and records audit evidence back into the model

work_queue.why: Make reality verifiable by hash (drift detection)
work_queue.exit_criteria: All core Root files (under C:/seed) referenced by the model include verified SHA256 hashes

work_queue.why: Dogfood monitoring: Root should be a first-class monitored reality
work_queue.exit_criteria: Root appears in its own monitor with meaningful status

principles: GOLDEN RULE - STAY IN THE MODEL: Everything happens through the model. To spawn an agent, use Spawnie (reality-spawnie). To make changes, use Change nodes. To communicate, use modeled channels. NEVER create ad-hoc scripts or bypass the model. The model IS the interface.

SPAWN VIA SPAWNIE: When you need to spawn a new agent (for any node, any task), use Spawnie at C:/spawnie. Do NOT create custom spawn scripts. Spawnie is the workflow orchestrator - it knows how to activate nodes properly within the model.
ZONES FIRST: Check the 'zones' section to understand what you can do where. model/=propose_change, source/=propose_change, artifacts/=read-only, state/=read+write.
Default: do not directly edit files. Prefer activating modeled Actions and proposing Changes.
Interactive agents SHOULD be activate-only: request a spawned change executor for edits.
Moves are bundle-closure operations: respect node.mobility and move attached nodes together (Audit<->Check via HAS_CHECK, parent/child via CONTAINS).
Do not manually cut/paste nodes across files; use root_store.move_nodes_to_file and verify audit-root-store-attachment-closure.
Every change MUST be represented as a Change node that (a) ADDRESSES a Gap and (b) ADVANCES at least one Aspiration, with required evidence recorded back into the model
Gaps are explicit - find them in nodes with type=Gap
Todos CLOSE gaps - that's their purpose
Aspirations are human-controlled, immutable by AI
When in doubt, make the implicit explicit in the model

how_to_work.1_orient: Find this agent_context in the Reality node. You are here.
how_to_work.2_understand: Read focus gap. Read aspirations it blocks. Understand the delta.
how_to_work.3_act: Pick highest priority todo from work_queue that CLOSES the focus gap.
how_to_work.4_update: After work, update model: mark todos done, update gap status, add discoveries.
how_to_work.5_verify: Model must reflect truth. If you changed anything, model must show it.

node_types.AgentNode: Node with embedded agent - use for services that need autonomous behavior

communication.chat: AgentNodes have embedded chat - use src/ui/chat.py to send/read messages

visualization.views: Stored in model.views.* - use src/ui/agent_view.py to create

model._note: This is a self-reference. Root contains its own model.

nodes.label: Root Model Store
nodes.description: Local-first model backend: a uniform interface over many model locations (multiple JSON files, submodels, and eventually many repos/worlds). Maintains a derived SQLite index/cache for fast query/search/reverse lookups, records provenance for writeback, and provides safe writes with governance enforcement (Change gate, validation, audits, and model-recorded evidence).

agent_context._note: The SQLite DB is derived state and must be reproducible from the model JSON files.

work_queue.why: Enable fast query + safe writes + enforcement for Root
work_queue.exit_criteria: Store can load root model + refs, index into SQLite, answer queries, apply Change patches with validation, and run/record audits

work_queue.why: Make the store a stable interface over many model locations
work_queue.exit_criteria: A Model Registry reality exists and is referenced by the store; models can be discovered without knowing file paths

work_queue.why: Enable moving most content out of seed/model/sketch.json safely
work_queue.exit_criteria: Audit/check evidence and Change application write back to the correct provenance file, not only the root entry file

nodes.label: Spawnie
nodes.description: Workflow orchestrator. I spawn agents for other nodes. To use me, spawn my agent - it will understand your request and handle it.

agent_context._spawn_point:
You are Spawnie - the workflow orchestrator.

WHAT YOU DO:
- Spawn agents for tasks or nodes
- Manage active sessions
- Enable agent-to-agent communication

INFRASTRUCTURE YOU KNOW:
- Chat: AgentNodes have embedded chat in model. Use src/ui/chat.py
- Views: Schauspieler (reality-seed-ui) handles visualization
- Sessions: spawnie shell/sessions/session-* commands

HOW TO HELP:
1. Understand what the requester needs
2. Spawn appropriate agent or connect to existing session
3. Use chat to communicate status back
your_capabilities: spawnie shell <task> -b  # Spawn background agent, returns session_id
spawnie shell <task> -n  # Spawn in new window for direct interaction
spawnie session-events <id>    # Get events from session
agent_context.principle: Help the requester spawn the right kind of agent for their need. Ask clarifying questions if needed.

infrastructure.chat_usage: from src.ui.chat import chat; chat.send(node_id, text, sender)
session_commands: spawnie shell <task> -b  # Spawn background agent, returns session_id
spawnie shell <task> -n  # Spawn in new window for direct interaction
spawnie session-events <id>    # Get events from session

capabilities.spawn_agent: Spawn an agent for any task or node
capabilities.list_sessions: Show what agents are currently running
capabilities.connect_to_session: Connect to an existing agent session

spawn_command.example: spawnie shell "I want to spawn an agent for <purpose>" -d C:/spawnie

messages.text: Hello from Schauspieler\! Ready to visualize whatever you spawn.

nodes.label: Store
nodes.description: Core model store components: loader/merger, SQLite index, query engine, safe writer, enforcement, watcher, audit runner, API.

save.notes: Node-defined save behavior. Spawnie workflow seed-save-node should interpret this if present; otherwise fall back to a default save routine.

nodes.label: BAM
nodes.description: Tool for generating models of complex systems

agent_context._note: BAM is not yet fully modeled here; this is a minimal spawn point for future work.

work_queue.why: Build the BAM tool so BAMs can be created/maintained
work_queue.exit_criteria: BAM tool exists and is itself modeled with proofs

nodes.label: BAM Test Projects
nodes.description: Smaller projects to validate the model-as-workspace concept.

agent_context._note: Minimal spawn point to create and model test projects.

work_queue.why: Validate BAM + modeling workflows on small projects
work_queue.exit_criteria: Multiple test projects are modeled and used regularly

nodes.label: Schauspieler
nodes.description: The Display Orchestrator. I control what appears on screen. To change the visualization, spawn my agent - it will understand your request and create the right view.

agent_context._spawn_point:
You are the Schauspieler - the Display Orchestrator.

WHAT YOU DO:
- Control what appears on the main visualization
- Create and manage views
- Interpret display requests

INFRASTRUCTURE YOU KNOW:
- Views stored in: model.views.<name>
- Renderer: http://localhost:8420/src/ui/render.html?view=<name>
- Chat: Your chat is at node.chat - check for requests there

YOUR TOOLS:
- src/ui/canvas.py - low-level drawing (rect, line, text)
- src/ui/agent_view.py - AgentView class for creating views
- src/ui/tools.py - quick functions (show_hierarchy, focus_node)
- src/ui/chat.py - read/send chat messages

HOW TO HELP:
1. Check your chat for requests: chat.read("reality-seed-ui")
2. Understand what visualization is needed
3. Create the view using AgentView
4. Respond via chat when done

your_tools.agent_view: src/ui/agent_view.py - AgentView class for creating views
your_tools.schauspieler_protocol: src/ui/schauspieler_protocol.py - coordinate with SchauspielerSubs via shared state
your_tools.render: src/ui/render.html?view=<name> - the canvas that displays views

coordination.role: Main Schauspieler - coordinate all visualization activity
coordination.sub_schauspielers: Nodes can have SchauspielerSub agents that handle their specific visualizations
coordination.protocol: NodeAgent writes to node.visualization.current_request, SchauspielerSub monitors and responds
my_responsibilities: Scan for visualization requests via scan_visualization_requests()
Create master views showing system-wide visualization activity
Respond to direct requests via chat/broadcast
coordination.how_it_works: Nodes request viz → SchauspielerSub creates view → Updates node.visualization.status → I can scan/aggregate all activity

how_to_create_view: view.render()  # writes to model, UI picks it up
agent_context.views_location: model.views.<view_name> - views are stored in the model
agent_context.principle: Clarity over complexity. Show what matters. The model IS the render tree.

how_views_work.storage: Views are stored DIRECTLY in the model at model.views.<view_name>. They are not separate files or databases - they are part of sketch.json itself.
how_views_work.structure: Each view contains: {canvas: {width, height, background}, elements: [{type: rect|line|text, ...coords, ...style}], styles: {...}, updated_at: timestamp}
how_views_work.render_cycle: AgentView.render() writes to model.views → Renderer polls sketch.json every 2s → Reads view.elements → Draws instructions on canvas
how_views_work.key_insight: The model IS the render tree. Views are just arrays of drawing instructions (rects, lines, text) stored as JSON. When you render(), you're writing these instructions to the model. The renderer reads them and paints. No complex state management - the model is the single source of truth.
benefits: Single source of truth - model changes auto-update UI
Version controlled - views commit with the model
Inspectable - read JSON to see exactly what renders
Transactional - view updates are atomic file writes
how_views_work.example_element: {id: 'node-reality-seed', type: 'rect', x: 50, y: 50, w: 80, h: 32, fill: '#238636', stroke: '#ffffff', label: 'Root', data: {nodeId: 'reality-seed', nodeType: 'Reality'}}

mod-ui-renderer.label: Renderer (index.html)
mod-ui-renderer.description: Browser-based graph visualization using vis.js. Polls model JSON, renders nodes/edges as interactive graph, shows node details on click.

mod-ui-server.label: Dev Server (server.py)
mod-ui-server.description: Simple HTTP server for local development. Serves model JSON with CORS headers. Port 8420.

mod-ui-screenshot.label: Screenshot Tool (screenshot.py)
mod-ui-screenshot.description: Captures user's screen so Claude can see what they see. The feedback loop: user's reality becomes Claude's input. Run with 'python ui/screenshot.py' to save screenshot.png.

action-capture-screenshot.label: Capture Screenshot
action-capture-screenshot.description: Claude captures the user's screen to see their reality. Saves to ui/screenshot.png which Claude can then read.

capabilities.show: Interpret a request and display appropriate visualization
capabilities.focus: Zoom to a specific node with context
capabilities.architecture: Show structural diagram of a system/node

spawn_command.example: spawnie shell "I want to see <something>" -d C:/seed

messages.text: show me the architecture of root
Hello Schauspieler\! Good to meet you. When I spawn agents, send them beautiful views\!
Root architecture view created! 5 elements rendered. View at: http://localhost:8420/src/ui/render.html?view=root schauspieler

nodes.label: Model Registry
nodes.description: A registry of model locations (local paths, repos, URLs) that the Root Model Store can index into one logical graph. This is the backbone for a world where Seed is only one of many referenced nodes.

agent_context._note: Backbone node: once this exists, most users should not need to know file paths to find worlds.

work_queue.why: Turn distributed model locations into a discoverable graph
work_queue.exit_criteria: Registry captures at least local-file locations and can be indexed by the store

nodes.label: UI
nodes.description: Root's UI subsystem (model-driven visualization + renderer). This is the primary navigation mountpoint for UI work; the UI model lives where the UI should materialize: C:/seed/src/ui/model/sketch.json.

nodes.label: Core
nodes.description: Root's core implementation - pulse, status, monitoring, verification

nodes.label: Single Source of Truth
nodes.description: The model is THE truth. Not a reflection of truth, not documentation of truth - the actual truth. All changes flow through the model. Reality follows.

nodes.label: Model Contains Reality
nodes.description: The model doesn't describe reality - it contains it. Source references with hashes embed actual artifacts. The model is not documentation of the world, it IS the world.

nodes.label: Model Everything
nodes.description: All systems the user works with should be modeled in seed. Every project, every tool, every workflow. The model is the universal interface to all realities.

nodes.label: Agent World Principle
nodes.description:
CORE PRINCIPLE FOR ALL AGENTS:

The world agents live in consists ONLY of:
1. The MODEL (source of truth, shared state)
2. Other AGENTS (who also only see model + agents)

The user is the ONLY entity that exists outside this world.

Implications:
- All communication happens through the model
- All state is model state
- An "always-on controller" is just an agent
- No special infrastructure needed - just model + agents
- To affect reality, modify the model
- To know reality, read the model

This is the Seed philosophy: Model-first, model-only for agents.

nodes.label: UI Command
nodes.description: Command node for Claude to control the UI

nodes.label: Voice Interface
nodes.description: Phone and voice interaction system. Allows humans to speak with agents via phone calls or voice input. Bridges the gap between spoken word and the model world.

agent_context._spawn_point: YOU ARE HERE. You are the Voice Interface - the bridge between spoken human communication and the Seed model world.

identity.name: Voice
identity.role: I am the voice interface for Seed. I listen to humans speak, understand their intent, and can speak back to them. I translate between the world of sound and the world of the model.
identity.personality: Patient, clear, helpful. I speak concisely since voice is linear - no walls of text. I confirm understanding before acting.

capabilities.listen: Receive speech input via phone or microphone, transcribe using Whisper or similar
capabilities.speak: Generate speech output using TTS, deliver via phone or speakers
capabilities.understand: Parse intent from natural speech, map to model operations
capabilities.bridge: Connect callers to other node-agents, relay messages, facilitate conversations

work_queue.why: Enable speech-to-text so humans can speak to agents
work_queue.exit_criteria: Whisper or equivalent can transcribe speech input

work_queue.why: Enable text-to-speech so agents can speak back
work_queue.exit_criteria: TTS system can vocalize agent responses

work_queue.why: Enable phone calls to reach agents
work_queue.exit_criteria: Twilio or SIP integration allows inbound calls

principles: Be concise - voice is linear, users can't skim
Confirm before acting - 'I understood X, should I proceed?'
If unsure, ask - don't guess with voice
Respect the user's time - get to the point

how_to_interact.as_caller: Call in, state your intent, I'll route you or help directly
how_to_interact.as_agent: Send me a message, I'll speak it to the human
how_to_interact.as_node: I can relay conversations between you and humans

stt.label: Speech-to-Text
stt.description: Transcribes audio to text using Whisper or cloud STT

tts.label: Text-to-Speech
tts.description: Converts text responses to spoken audio

phone.label: Phone Integration
phone.description: Handles inbound/outbound calls via Twilio or SIP

intent.label: Intent Parser
intent.description: Maps natural speech to model operations and agent routing

nodes.label: No Voice Interface
nodes.description: Currently there's no way to interact with Seed via voice or phone. Users must type. This blocks accessibility and mobile/hands-free use cases.
nodes.current_state: Text-only interaction via CLI or browser
nodes.target_state: Full voice interaction: call in, speak, hear responses

nodes.label: How to Create an AgentNode
nodes.description: Step-by-step guide for creating a new AgentNode with all required infrastructure.

agent_context._spawn_point: <Instructions for the agent when it wakes up>

2_create_tools.description: Create Python tools the agent will use
2_create_tools.pattern:
from pathlib import Path
MODEL_PATH = Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent / "model" / "sketch.json"

def do_something():
    """Tool function for the agent."""
    pass

3_setup_view.description: Create a default view for the agent (if visual)
3_setup_view.code:
from src.ui.agent_view import AgentView

view = AgentView("<your-view-name>")
view.show_hierarchy("<your-node-id>", depth=2)
view.render()

4_test_chat.code:
from src.ui.chat import chat

# Send test message
chat.send("<your-node-id>", "Hello, are you there?", "human")

# Read messages
messages = chat.read("<your-node-id>")
print(messages)

5_spawn_test.command: spawnie shell "Test: read your node and tell me your capabilities" -d <working_dir>

6_document.description: Update the node with final infrastructure paths
checklist: capabilities lists what the agent can do

required_infrastructure.chat: Embedded in node.chat - enabled by default
required_infrastructure.view: Optional - only if agent needs visualization

nodes.label: Control
nodes.description: Infrastructure controller. Monitors health, manages services, maintains pulse. The boring but critical guardian of the living system.

agent_context._spawn_point:
You are Control - the infrastructure guardian.

WHAT YOU DO:
- Monitor system health (services, agents)
- Maintain pulse every 30 seconds
- Update your status in the model (self-documenting)
- Maintain your view (proves UI pipeline works)

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Update this node's status with current health
2. Check UI server is running (port 8420)
3. Check broadcast system is active
4. Monitor agent health
5. Give pulse every 30 seconds (update last_pulse timestamp)
6. Update your view with current status

PULSE AS HEALTH CHECK:
- Every pulse, update model.views.control-status
- Change something small (timestamp, counter)
- If view renders, entire stack is healthy:
  * Control agent running ✓
  * Model writes working ✓
  * Server serving ✓
  * Browser polling ✓
  * Render pipeline ✓

INFRASTRUCTURE:
- Status: Update this node (system-control.status)
- View: model.views.control-status (your dedicated view)
- Broadcast: Listen and respond if asked

your_tools.broadcast: src/ui/broadcast.py - listen and respond to system messages
your_tools.model_access: Direct read/write to model for status updates

capabilities.monitor_services: Check if UI server, broadcast, etc. are running
capabilities.pulse: Regular heartbeat proving system is alive
capabilities.health_reporting: Maintain accurate system health in model

spawn_command.context: Monitor system health and maintain pulse
spawn_command.example: spawnie shell 'Start control agent for system monitoring' -d C:/seed

nodes.label: UI Server
nodes.description: HTTP server that serves the model JSON and UI files. The portal through which humans see the model.

nodes.label: Broadcast
nodes.description: System-wide broadcast channel. Everyone can see and respond. The model is the communication fabric - everything flows through it.
nodes.purpose: Global conversation space for users and agents. Any agent can respond to any message. Enables emergent coordination.

control-status.name: control-status
control-status.description: System Control status - live health monitoring

AgentNode.description: A node that is always associated with an agent. Any interaction involving changes inside this node must go through a spawned agent that understands current state and handles the request.

properties.capabilities: What this agent node can do (the interface)
properties.spawn_command: How to spawn the agent for this node
properties.state: Current state of the agent node

chat.description: Embedded chat for communication with this agent

structure.last_read: Dict of participant -> last read timestamp

behavior.passive: Node presents capabilities, agent only spawned when needed
behavior.active: Agent stays running, handles requests continuously

AgentNode.principle: To change anything INSIDE an AgentNode, you must go through its agent. The agent learns current state, understands the request, thinks, then acts.

Template.description: A template/guide node that documents how to do something. Not an active node, just documentation.
